name: Holiday Inn Hotel & Suites Boston-Peabody

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Got an upgrade to a king suite for our additional night stay in Peabody and it was great. Very large living room with kitchen and dining table (seats 4) couch, chair and nice flat screen TV. Spacious king bedroom with another flat screen. Good size bathroom also
reviews.title: Nice suprise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a relaxing evening with some drinks and a movie. Could have stayed longer but much to my dismay life is not one long vacation. Noted a few housekeeping issues ie ironing board left out, trash not emptied in bathroom the used containers of bath products left in the bathroom. All in all a very nice stay. We did not have breakfast but they have breakfast available in the restaurant or as room service. The hotel is also attached to a Carabbas restaurant.
reviews.title: Dont go there

reviews.text: Room are OK, but the for the price ARE YOU KIDDING ME? They charge us an extra 124$ and i dont know why! The breakfast buffet was disgusting, i wouldnt give that to my dog honestly. Save your money and dont go there. AC make for noise than a tractor.
reviews.title: Wedding block

reviews.text: Aaron in sales made it so easy to book our wedding block. It was convenient to Salem and Boston for guests from out of town. The king suite was perfect for getting ready before the wedding. The bed was super comfortable and the rooms were clean. And, despite having four weddings during the same weekend I never heard the other guests. All-in-all a great experience.
reviews.title: Well-appointed suites

reviews.text: We were more than pleased with our 1 bedroom king suite. For our family of 3, it was the perfect layout. The parents had a comfortable king bed and a flat screen TV and our daughter had a pull out couch with her own flat screen! The dining table and kitchen had everything we needed. Great stay!
reviews.title: Traveling through experience

reviews.text: I actually stayed here for two separate one night stays before races along the North Shore. Hotel was very accommodating as i was allowed a late checkout each time and they also upgraded me to a suite each time as I am a plat. Priority Club Member. It can be tough to get out of times, but there is a carrabara's right next door to limit trips out for food. The rooms were very clean as were the hallways and the lobby was very nice as well . And the cute girls in their twenty's at the front desk was o.k. as well.I would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Solid Holiday Inn- Exactly what you would expect from a Holiday Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first room we checked into had a really damp smell to it so we changed room. Second room that we were moved to was good and you could see that renovations had been carried out. We ate at the restaurant in the morning for breakfast and was far from impressed, the cooked food looked awful and the pastries were stale. The hotel is right on a major road and it is difficult getting out of there!
reviews.title: Typical Holiday Inn but some problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We got the room on PriceLine and were quite disappointed that we were not closer to our destination. It was DH's 40th high school reunion. The HI was 10 miles down the road and we were bummed.
reviews.title: It turned out to be a good thing

reviews.text: It is a great property. The lobby is nice, the rooms are nice, and the beds are comfortable. Each employee we came in contact with was incredibly nice. They have all been to BE NICE school or something.
reviews.title: Good but old hotel

reviews.text: The coffee is a little difficult to find; head over to the hotel restaurant. The coffee is right outside the entrance and quite worth the trip. Good coffee and we like our coffee!
reviews.title: Nice hotel...with a safety issue

reviews.text: This is a sub-par Holiday Inn. The location was good for us but that was about all. We had requested a king bed but they only had double beds unless we wanted to wait (it was after check in time). The room smelled like cigarette smoke and we tried to open the windows to air it out but of course the windows don't open. The room was just okay but my husband found a hair (not his) in the bed...ugh. The worst part: I was flabbergasted to find they charged me a $200 fine for smoking!!! It was a no smoking hotel where our room stunk of cigarettes and then they try to charge me for smoking? I don't smoke, my husband doesn't smoke. After 7 (seven!!) calls trying to get a manager that could help me, he said they would show me proof of smoking. Of course they couldn't show proof because we DIDN'T SMOKE! He then said they would take the charge off (they better) but I didn't get an apology. Beware!
reviews.title: Bad experience

reviews.text: we did stay there for 9 nights, we had 2 double beds. CLlean. We loved the location which was important to us- easy enough access to get where we wanted to get. The stff at reception was helpful.( hi Leonard)
reviews.title: Good and cheap

reviews.text: next door is Italian restaurant which we visited on our first night- the staff at reception recommended it.
reviews.title: Thanks for the upgrade!

reviews.text: kids enjoyed pool, at some point it was very busy and seems that water was a it chilly?
reviews.title: A great hotel.

reviews.text: We booked at Last Minute Travel for a 3 star, and got this Holiday Inn. Check in was smooth, but we were given a room with 2 beds when we asked for a king. Clerk quickly changed us, giving us a lovely king suite. Very comfortable. Bathrooms upgraded with marble counters. The bad news -- our reservation was for 2 nights, but hotel had only been informed of 1 night. So when we returned to the hotel for our second nights, they had locked us out of our room. After I proved (by showing a copy of my reservation confirmation from LMT) that we HAD booked and prepaid for 2 nights, the hotel corrected their records and all was well.
reviews.title: Beware the area shuttle it will abandon you

reviews.text: Expected a run down old Holiday Inn in Peobody but was blown away by the updates. This hotel could have fit right in in boston. We have stayed at the Marriot Long Warf in boston 4 times and the hotel rooms in the Holiday inn were just as nice ( obviously without the waterfront view) I recommend this hotel for sure.
reviews.title: Great newly renovated gem

reviews.text: this is my first review ever, that is how bad this hotel is. I was in Saugus for a family occassion. No wake up call, AC in the room sounds like a freight train, the staff appeared like they don't want to be there, the big disaster was the restaurant!!!! never seen anything like it, no silverware on the tables, no napkins, no servers( barely) food was terrible... no mangers to talk to but noone seems to care.
reviews.title: ONE OF THE WORST STAYS EVER!!!!

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Holiday Inn in Peabody. The location of the hotel was very easy to fine and is located right next to a Carraba's Italian Grill restaurant, which I am sure would be good as a dinner option. Check in at the hotel was easy, and the lobby looked like the typical renovated Holiday Inns. My room was a standard king room, and at first glance I thought it looked newly remolded and modern. The room had a nice work desk with comfortable task chair, and very fast hi-speed wireless internet access which is hard to find sometimes.
reviews.title: Okay Holiday Inn ruined by icky wet carpet and A/C unit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Things went downhill when I took off my socks and realized that the entire carpet was damp. I honestly have no idea where it was coming from. My only thought was that the A/C unit was spitting out too much moisture into the air causing the carpet to get damp. It really grossed me out and made walking around the room barefoot uncomfortable.
reviews.title: Nice stay!
Save your money and health
reviews.text: Speaking of the A/C unit, it was a mess. It was really loud and seemed to only put out warm or freezing cold air. I wound up turning it off in the middle of the night so I could sleep better.

aka: Holiday Inn Hotel And Suites Boston-Peabody
description: The Holiday Inn Hotel and Suites Boston - Peabody is conveniently located between Downtown Boston and Logan International Airport and the historical coastal towns North of Boston. Whether you are enticed by the quaint seaport villages of nearby Salem, Gloucester, and Marblehead or the excitement of Boston's Faneuil Hall Marketplace, Freedom Trail, and Fenway Park, the Holiday Inn Peabody is the ideal location to experience all that New England has to offer. Our hotel is now completely smoke-free and renovations are scheduled for completion later this spring. This Boston North Shore hotel will feature 183 newly refurbished guestrooms, including 20 two-room suites. All rooms and suites are equipped with 27' televisions and high speed Internet access. Suites include kitchenettes with mini-refrigerator and microwave and living area with sleep sofa. Unwind in our indoor pool, outdoor courtyard or work out in our fully-equipped fitness center. When hunger strikes, Carrabba's Italian Grill where you can enjoy a casual dinner in a warm, festive environment, the menu offers a variety of freshly made dishes cooked to order in a lively exhibition kitchen. For meetings and social events, our flexible meeting space can accommodate groups from 5-450 people. Ample free parking is available for cars as well as buses. Enjoy ease of access from I-93, I-95, Logan airport (BOS), and Boston's many area colleges for graduation weekends.
